div1.p: Leake identifies items Carter sent to him to photograph.

div1.head: Letter from James P. Leake to Laura Armistead Carter, February 19, 1935
div1.opener:
JAMES P. LEAKE, M. D.
2733 ONTARIO ROAD
WASHINGTON, D. C.
3:55 P.M. Feb. 19, 1935
Dear Laura,
div1.p:
Your letter came eight minutes ago.
Not wanting to risk more than the minimum at
one time, I took down to the photographer's the
three items you specifically mentioned, but
his drier isn't working, so I wouldn't leave
them there. He will let me know as
soon as it works.

In order to make identification more
certain, I had numbered the items in
accordance with your typed list, Item #1 being
the typed copy (not carbon) of the original MSS, with
your Father's script note (in pencil) on sheet 29. Item #2
(in an envelope, and it needs it) is Reed's letter. Item #3b
is your Father's script note to Lazear, on the back of #3a,
a typed copy of the omitted hypothesis (as marked “ Omit”
on page 29 of item #1)

I have called #4a the “more readable list of houses”
printed on a double sheet, on the back of which is #4b a penned
memo in your Father's hand about taking eggs and larvae
to Lazear, etc. This is attached to #4, the reprint lent to Lazear.
I have called #5 the two pages from a carbon of your Father's
letter to Dr. John Ross, #6 two pages from his letter
to Dr. Bruce, and #7 the carbon of your letter to
Dr. Kelly.

I have with them the only copy, except
my personal one, available, of Reed's Preliminary
Note. Perhaps I had best have that
photostated, too, instead of sending it
with the first installment.

It is fine to hear from you and Chase
will be delighted to know she is to see
you.

We are all well, despite this penmanship
which is much more than Sir Henry's.
